question.text: Each one of the following options has a rule regarding a certain animal group and an exception from that group written in brackets. Which one is incorrect?

options.text: Reptiles have an incompletely four-chambered heart. (Crocodilus)
Amphibians have two pairs of limbs. (Ichthyophis)
Sponges are found in marine water. (Spongilla)

solution.text: Reptiles have an incompletely four-chambered heart. Crocodilus (crocodile) has a completely four-chambered heart. Amphibians have two pairs of limbs. Ichthyophis is a limbless amphibian. Sponges are found in marine water. Spongilla is a freshwater sponge. Roundworms (Ascehelminthes) are dioecious in which males and females are separate. Ascaris is also a dioecious roundworm following the rule.
